data.title: Shirin Ebadi
data.meta_description: News about Shirin Ebadi, including commentary and archival articles published in The New York Times.
data.text:
U.S. Seeks Removal of Iran From U.N. Women’s Rights Agency

At an informal meeting of the United Nations Security Council on Wednesday, the American ambassador called on the global community to give its “moral support” to protesters in Iran.

By Farnaz Fassihi

A Daughter Is Beheaded, and Iran Asks if Women Have a Right to Safety

The so-called honor killing of a 14-year-old girl in Iran has shaken the country and forced an examination of its failure to protect women and children.

By Farnaz Fassihi

Opinion

Tricked Into Cheating and Sentenced to Death

The story of how Iranian agents caught my husband with another woman, threatened to stone him to death and then forced him to denounce me.

By Shirin Ebadi

On YouTube, Iran Activists Urge America to Back Nuclear Deal

The messages of support from Iranian human rights activists are a new element in the emotional campaigns for and against the deal in the United States.

By Rick Gladstone

IHT Rendezvous

The Trust Women Conference

The International Herald Tribune and ThomsonReuters Foundation will host a gathering on Tuesday and Wednesday to examine how law can be used to further the empowerment of women. Watch the streaming video starting at 10 a.m. London time on Tuesday. Read our preview stories now.

By International Herald Tribune
